programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Los Angeles and Denver split their four season meetings, but the Nuggets won seven of the last eight at home after a 126-103 victory on Jan. 8 behind 21 points and nine assists from Jamal Murray, along with 19 points from Michael Porter Jr.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Detroit won its last three meetings with New York to take the regular-season series, 3-1, after a 115-106 victory on April 10 behind 36 points and eight assists from Cade Cunningham, along with 18 points and 13 rebounds from Jalen Duren.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Memphis won three of its four regular-season meetings with Dallas, including a 119-104 win at home on Jan. 6 behind 35 points and 13 rebounds from Jaren Jackson Jr. and a 132-97 home win on April 13 behind 31 points from Lamar Stevens.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Featured first-round middleweight bouts: Impa Kasanganay vs. Fabian Edwards; Sadibou Sy vs. Dalton Rosta; featured lightweight bouts: Alexander Shabliy vs. Brent Primus; Gadzhi Rabadanov vs. Marc Diakiese; Mads Burnell vs. Jay Jay Wilson.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Milwaukee won three of its four regular-season meetings with Indiana, including a 126-119 victory in the last matchup on March 15 behind 34 points and 10 rebounds from Giannis Antetokounmpo, along with 25 points from Damian Lillard.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Logan Hughes enters the series leading Texas Tech in home runs, RBIs and slugging percentage; Arizona State's Jack Martinez (4-2, 4.83) allowed four runs (three earned) on four hits over 5.0 innings in a 7-4 win over Cincinnati on April 12.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Mississippi State (25-5) is 3-1 on the road this season after defeating UAB, 8-4, on March 19; Northwestern (13-9) enters the series against the Bulldogs on a seven-game winning streak; inaugural meeting between the programs.

programme.title: Goliath Fishing
programme.desc: James Marko travels across South Florida on fishing expeditions in hopes of reeling in trophy-caliber fish at each one of his stops, discussing the techniques he implements to find success out on the water and the equipment he uses to reel them in.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: The top knockouts in UFC history are showcased in full detail, including top brawlers scoring vicious strikes in championship bouts, rivals who want to leave their opponent cold on the ground, and newcomers testing their mettle against veterans.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Mississippi State (25-5) is 3-1 on the road this season after defeating UAB, 8-4, on March 19; Northwestern (13-9) enters the series against the Bulldogs on a seven-game winning streak; inaugural meeting between the programs.

programme.title: College Gymnastics
programme.desc: The NCAA women's gymnastics season culminates with the National Championship in Fort Worth, Texas, following the semi-finals round on April 17; LSU claimed their first championship in program history at the 2024 edition of the tournament.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Virginia's Jay Woolfolk (2-2, 4.34) allowed three runs on four hits over 6.1 innings in a 7-5 win over Pittsburgh on April 12; No. 7-ranked Florida State's Jamie Arnold (4-1, 2.40) has 57 strikeouts with 15 walks over 41.1 innings this season.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: Director Nelson George details the life and career of Earvin "Magic" Johnson after the three-time MVP announced to the world that he was HIV-positive, examining the public's reaction, Magic's personal journey decades later, and more.

programme.title: College Spring Football
programme.desc: Colorado went 9-4 last season but will have to replace Heisman Trophy winner Travis Hunter and quarterback Shedeur Sanders, as fans are given a chance to see what the Buffaloes may have for the upcoming season during the exhibition game.

programme.desc: Oscar Piastri moved into second place and trails Lando Norris by only three points after winning at Bahrain for his second victory in the last three races; Max Verstappen averaged 229.271 kph en route to his win at Saudi Arabia last year.

programme.desc: Memorable bouts throughout UFC history are relived, showcasing the two fighters' paths to the bout, the training they went through to get ready for the contest and highlights from the bout to show who came out of the Octagon the winner.

programme.title: The 129th Boston Marathon
programme.desc: Ethiopia's Sisay Lemma finished with a time of 2:06:17 to defeat countryman Mohamed Esa by 41 seconds, while two-time defending champion Evans Chebet finished third; Hellen Obiri of Kenya won the women's title for the second-straight year.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: John Elway, Todd Blackledge, Jim Kelly, Tony Eason, Ken O'Brien and Dan Marino were the six quarterbacks selected in the first round of the 1983 NFL Draft, and three of those players went on to craft Hall of Fame careers in the NFL.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Peyton Manning entered the 1997 season as the Heisman favorite after announcing his return to Tennessee, but other names including Charles Woodson, Ryan Leaf and Randy Moss would make it one of the most memorable runs for the prestigious award.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Bowlers compete in the preliminary rounds of the PBA members-only Tier 1 major championship for a top prize of $100,000; Marshall Kent won his seventh career PBA Tour title and maiden major championship crown in last year's edition.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Hawthorn (4-1-0) suffered its first defeat of 2025 after falling to Port Adelaide, 121-91, on April 13; Geelong (3-2-0) has won five of the past six encounters against the Hawks, including a 110-59 triumph last season in Round 17.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending XFL champion San Antonio (0-3) is in search of its first win after a 26-23 loss to Michigan despite Kellen Mond; DC (3-0) stayed undefeated with a 27-15 win over St. Louis behind three passing touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Memphis (0-3) is in search of its first win this season after an 18-17 loss to Houston; Michigan (2-1) won its first season meeting with the Showboats, 26-12, on March 30 behind 163 passing yards and two total touchdowns from Bryce Perkins.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Chandler Smith secured his first Truck Series win of the season and first since Richmond in 2022 with a victory at Bristol over Kyle Larson, who won the last Truck Series race at Rockingham back in 2013, beating Joey Logano by 0.177 seconds.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Chandler Smith secured his first Truck Series win of the season and first since Richmond in 2022 with a victory at Bristol over Kyle Larson, who won the last Truck Series race at Rockingham back in 2013, beating Joey Logano by 0.177 seconds.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 14-ranked Texas Tech, who has swept four series in the Big 12 this season, has a team batting average of .321 in 2025; Miranda Stoddard hit .714 with two HRs and had five RBIs to help No. 13-ranked Arizona win the series vs. Utah last weekend.

programme.title: Driven By Speed: Keanu Reeves vs Cody Jones
programme.desc: Action movie star Keanu Reeves and Cody Jones from Dude Perfect take to the legendary Indianapolis Motor Speedway for a head-to-head race, as all-access footage shows the training and preparation between car and driver leading up to the event.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Cavalry and Vancouver played to draws in two of their last three meetings with the most recent matchup on Sept. 28 ending in a goalless scoreline; Cavalry posted 15 total shots, to Vancouver's 6, while keeping 66 percent of possession.

programme.title: NHRA Sportsman Series
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Bowlers compete for a $100,000 top prize in the final; Bill O'Neill captured the 14th title and the third major PBA championship of his career with a 209-178 victory over top-seeded Tom Smallwood in last year's edition held in Wichita, Kan.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: GWS (4-1-0) is allowing just 67.0 points per contest in 2025; Adelaide (3-2-0) snapped a four-match losing streak to the Giants with a 94-78 triumph last season, as Izak Rankine 21 disposals, seven inside 50s and five clearances in the first half.

programme.title: NHRA Sportsman Series
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Los Angeles claimed a 3-2 victory against Portland in their most recent meeting on April 29 through a winner from forward Denis Bouanga; midfielder Timothy Tillman found the net and made 6 tackles for Los Angeles in the win at home.
